gurmukhi: pwrs nwQ bfo rx jIqo ] jwnuk BeI dUsr krxwrjun BwrQ so huie bIqo ]
transliteration: Paaras Naath Bado Ran Jeeto|| Jaanouk Bhaidoosar Karnaarjoun Bhaarath So Hue Beeto||
translation: Parasnath won the war and he appeared like Karan or Arjun;

gurmukhi: bhu ibiD cly pÍwih sRox ky rQ gj Asv bhwey ] BY kr jwn BXo bf Awhv swq smuMdR ljwey ]
transliteration: Bahu Bidh(i) Chale Pravaah(i) Sron Ke Rath Gad Asav Bahaae|| Bhai Kar Jaan Bhayo Bad Aahav Saat Samounndra Lajaae||
translation: Various streams of blood flowed and in that current the charious, horses and elephant also flowed; all the seven ocean felt shy before that current of blood (of war);

gurmukhi: jh qh cly Bwj sMnXwsI bwxn AMg pHwry ] jwnuk b`jR ieMdR ky BY qy p`b sp`C isDwry ]
transliteration: Jah Tah Chale Bhaaj Sannyaasibaanan An Prahdare|| Jaanouk Bajjra Indra Ke Bhai Te Pabb Sapachchh Sidhdare||
translation: Having been struck by the arrows on their limbs, the Sannyasis ran away hither and thither like the mounts flying away, getting fearful of Indra’s Vajra, attaching wings to themselves;

gurmukhi: ijh iqh igrq sRox kI Dwrw Ar GUmq iBBrwq ] inMdw krq CqRIX Drm kI Bjq dso ids jwq ]42]116]
transliteration: Jih Tih Girat Daron Kidhaaraa Ar Ghoomat Bhibhraat|| Nindaa Karat Chhatreeya Dharam Kibhajat Daso Dis Jaat||42||116||
translation: The current of blood was flowing on all sides and the wounded warriors were roaming here and there; they were running away in all the ten directions and were slandering the discipline of Kshatriyas.42.116.

gurmukhi: jyqk jIAq bcy sMnXwsI ] qRws mrq iPr bhur n Awey hoq Bey bnbwsI ]
transliteration: Jetak Jeeat Bache Sannyaasee|| Traas Marat Phir Bahur Na Aae Hot Bhae Banbaasee||
translation: Those Sannysis who survived, they did not return because of fear and went to the forest;

gurmukhi: dys ibdys FUMF bn byhV jh qh pkr sMGwry ] Koj pqwl AkwS surg khu jhwN qhwN cun mwry ]
transliteration: Des Bides Dhoondh Ban Behad Jah Tah Pakar Sanhdare|| Khoj Pataal Akaadh Surag Kauh Jahaan Tahaan Choun Mdare||
translation: They were picked up from various countries and the forests and killed and searching for them in the sky and the nether-world, they were all destroyed;

gurmukhi: ieh ibiD nws kry sMnXwsI Awpn mqh mqwXo ] Awpn nXws isKwie sBn khu Awpn mMqR clwXo ]
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Naas Dare Sannyaasiaapan Matah Mataayo|| Aapan Nyaas Sikhaae Sabhan Kauh Aapan Mantra Chalaayo||
translation: In this way, killing the Sannyasis, Parasnath propagated his own sect; and extended his own mode of worship;

gurmukhi: jy jy ghy iqno Gwiel iqn kI jtw muMfweI ] dohI dUr d`q kI kInI Awpn Pyr duhweI 117 ]
transliteration: Je Je Gade Tino Te Ghaail Mounndaaee|| Dohidoor Datt Kikeeniaapan Pher Duhaaee||117||
translation: The wounded ones, who were caught, their matted locks were shaved off and ending the impact of Dutt, Parasnath extended his his fame.117.

gurmukhi: ieh ibiD Pwg kiRpwnn Kyly ] soBq Fwl mwl BF mwlY mUT gulwln syly ]
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Phaag Kridaanan Khele|| Sobhat Dhaal Maal Daph Maalai Moondh Gulaalan Sele||
translation: In this way, Holi was played with the sword; the shields took the place of tabors and the blood became gulal (red colour);
